result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrett M Niemiec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrett M Niemiec

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:05 PM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Jarrett M Niemiec.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record. 
State notes payment of Defendant of Buy Money in the amount of $680 to the Waukesha Metro Drug Unit.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 2-3 are Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM ON PROBATION:  15 MONTHS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

CONDITION TIME: 60 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Receipt of Buy Money, filed by Attorney Cotton.
Cover letter in re: receipt of buy money, filed by Attorney Cotton.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:04 AM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was scheduled for plea and sentencing, but Defendant has been unable to pay off the buy money yet and requests more time. 
Court resets the plea and sentencing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Treatment letter filed by Atty. Anthony Cotton.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:38 AM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court with attorney Olivia Garman on behalf of Anthony D Cotton.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests one further proceedings date to negotiate with the state.

  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:19 AM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:11 AM Defendant Jarrett M Niemiec in court with attorney Olivia G Garman.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
